loans.name: Alpha Bonoh's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in Kanikay village, near Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. These teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva based in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 3,500,000 for their group in in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Alpha is the featured leader of this team. The 53-year-old is a native of Kanikay village. He is married to a farmer and the couple has five children – two in primary school, two in secondary, and one not yet of school-going age. Alpha has been a school teacher for 35 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Set is aged 55 years and widowed. She has six children. To support the family, she has been in farming rice and making Khmer noodles for 34 years. To supplement the income, she also raises pigs. The current business earns her family about 12,700 KHR per day to meet their needs. 

Set has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she successfully used the past loans to better support her family to have sufficient food. 

She is now applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. She is going to use this loan to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her pig raising business, so as to sell them for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for raising.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 33 years old and lives in Sevan, Armenia. She married young and has two children, a 12-year-old son and a 16-year-old daughter. She graduated from secondary school but did not work since her daughter was born soon after her graduation. 
 
The only income for her family was from her husband who worked in the Russian Federation. It was a very hard time for her new family, but Hasmik has overcome her difficulties and today runs her own business.  

Hasmik rents a stall in Sevan Market and resells women’s and men’s clothing. She buys clothes from the wholesale markets in Yerevan twice each month, transports them to Sevan with her husband’s help and resells them in her stall. Hasmik and her husband can now care for their family themselves. She is very happy that her family's life has improved and they save money for the future of her children. Hasmik says that she tries to forget about her hard life in the past and her main aim is her children's future. She is convinced that their dream will come true. 

Hasmik is asking for a loan of 650,000 AMD loan to buy spring and summer seasonal clothing from the wholesale markets to sell in her stall.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Leourb's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Battambang Province’s Ek Phnom district, Leourb is 35 years old and has six children. To support the daily basics in the family, she runs a small grocery stall at home as her main source of income and supplements her income through rice farming and pig-raising. She has been with this business for several years. 

With VisionFund, Loeurb is a third-time borrower who has fully repaid her previous loans. The previous loans helped her earn a decent income and improve her living conditions. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR, whereas the third group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Loeurb will use her loan portion to pay for the reaping fee and to buy pig feed. She hopes to collect her crop yield and sell at a good price so she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for the reaping fee and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena. She previously repaid a 9,000 PHP loan that was used to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her business. Lorena’s earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Lorena is asking for a 25,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her stall in the community market. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorena hopes that her business grows and dreams of a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell in her market stall.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is a 41-year-old mother of three children who lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province.  Be is a local farmer who grows rice, corn and soybeans. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and earns up to 28,500 KHR per day. This is Be’s fourth loan with VisionFund. She has completely repaid her last loan. It helped her lifestyle to grow at a good pace. 

Be is in need of working capital to support her cash crops and is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She will use a portion to buy one hectare of rice farming and the rest to support her corn and soybean plantings. She hopes this purchase will expand her agricultural product growing scale and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy one hectare of rice farming and to support her corn and soybean farming.

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Savoeurn, a local farmer from Battambang Province, is 32 years old and has one little kid to cater for. To feed her family, she manages one hectare of pineapple growing area; it is the business that she has been in for 10 years and it returns her about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle, she is in her fourth cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The successful past loans have empowered her to sustain her living. Now, she is in a microloan group consisting of two female members. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy pineapple seedlings and fertilizer for her pineapple field. 

She hopes grow her crops on time and get more yield so that she can earn more income to build a new and decent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings and fertilizer for her pineapple field.

loans.name: Soeurm's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Soeurm is a mother of three children. Currently, her two children have been sent to school while the remaining one is still under-aged for school. To support the daily cost of living, she grows rice while her husband is a house builder and also helps his wife on the farmland during the spare time. 

For her 8 years of engagement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 25,800 KHR per day. Her first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, was four cycles ago. The past loans - which she completely paid back - provided a positive impact on her lifestyle, as her living condition are getting better than before. 

For this cycle, she is in a group of four seeking a new loan with VisionFund. The total of her group loan is 3,800,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is the loan portion for Soeurm, as the group leader. Soeurm will use her portion to pay for plowing and labor fees, plus pesticide costs. 

She hopes to grow her rice timely and gain more yield with high income, lest she can maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and labor fees, as well as pesticide costs.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
A 42-year-old mother of four kids, Nary is a widow who currently only has one schoolchild under her dependency. As a single mother, she struggles in earning her daily cost of living through Chinese noodle selling and a cafe. For her eight year involvement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 27,200 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has fully paid back her past loans and feels so confident that she can upgrade her living in a gradual manner. 

Now, to better support her business, she formed a group of five members to request a new loan. The total of her group loan is 6,200,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy grocery items to support her business. Moreover, she also wants to fix her house in a proper condition. 

She hopes her business will improve progressively, and also hopes to own her house in good condition.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to support her food selling business.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
The sole breadwinner in a family comprised of herself and two schoolchildren, Sokha is 32 years old. She is a vendor who runs a small grocery stall, in order to earn her living and support her children. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Sokha has never been with VisionFund before now. She is a first-time borrower, leading a group of three female members. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items to resell at her stall. She hopes this purchase will replenish her grocery stall in time to meet customer demand, and earn her more income to sustain her living and cover her children’s education expenses.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell at her stall

loans.name: Sereyrothny's Group

texts.en:
Sereyrothny, a local farmer from Sangke district of Battambang Province, is 32 years old and married with two children who are still in school. To provide a daily supple of decent food for her children, she grows cabbage, garlic, and cucumber. To help her in generating additional income, her husband also works as a construction worker during his free time, besides helping her farm. The current business returns her 45,800 KHR per day from the business that she has been with for 10 years. 

In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has fully paid back her past loan already with success. Her past sub-sequence loans have sustained her living and better supported her business gradually. 

Now, she and her joint members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. For her, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and its container. She hopes this purchase will help her to boost her productivity and reduce her losses due to the pests. Moreover, she hopes to make more income to get a pump and a water pipe for her cash-crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and its container.

loans.name: Vun's Group

texts.en:
A 59-year-old mother of five children and a rural villager from Ek Phnom district of Battambang Province, Vun is a local farmer whose rice farming is a primary source of income in order to deal with her family’s hardship. The current business earns her about 25,600 KHR per day. 

Vun has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for the past five cycles and has completely repaid the loans already. After the loans, her living conditions are getting better than before and she also can manage her business in a good pace. 

Now, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees, rice seeds, and potash purchasing. She hopes to increase her income and better her living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, rice seeds, and potash purchasing.

loans.name: Phany's Group

texts.en:
Phany, 47, is a mother who has been blessed with four children. All of them are currently studying at the local, state school. The primary source of Phany's income is dry season rice planting, on two hectares of farmland.  Having been engaged in this business for 15 years, she is able to earn up to 43,300 KHR per day. She can manage to support a daily three meals for her family.  

This is Phany's seventh loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She fully repaid the past loans. For this loan cycle in a group of two, she is a leader requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR, while her co-borrower is applying for 100,000 KHR. Phany will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farm.  She hopes to realize more income and make a good living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice farm

loans.name: Youra's Group

texts.en:
A rural resident from Battambang Province, Youra is 51 years old, married, and has two children. To maintain her household, she raises chickens, while her husband works for others for a fee. She has been involved in the poultry business for ages, and she is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth loan for Youra with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loans with success, and the use of the credit has relieved her family’s burden and improved their livelihood. Now in a group of two, she is the leader. She is seeking to borrow 800,000 KHR, while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Youra will use her loan portion to buy more chickens to raise, and to build a chicken coop. She hopes to raise more chickens and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to raise, and to build a chicken coop

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn is aged 47 years and married. She lives in a wooden house with her family members, in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice. Having been in this business for ten years, she manages to earn about 15,000 KHR per day and can save about 7,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Khorn’s group of three women. Khorn has been with VisionFund for one previous loan. She completely paid back the past loan and successfully used it to better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, Khorn wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her rice yield and earn more income, to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn, a citizen from a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, is age 49 years and married with six children, thee of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last 15 years, she has been farming rice and selling vegetables and fish. Her husband supplements their income by working as a motor taxi driver. With the current business, she can earn about 60,000 riels (KHR) per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Horn has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles already and she completely paid back her loans, which have enabled her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and also use a portion of it to buy more vegetables and fish to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is aged 43 years and married, and she has three dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, in Battambang province. She earns a living by farming rice, while her husband works as a laborer to help earn income to support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 25,000 per day from the current businesses, and they can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Pheap has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for four previous cycles. Pheap successfully used her previous loans to improve her family's living conditions. Now leading her group of two to apply for a loan, Pheap will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and to pay for farm labor. She hopes to harvest more rice and sell it for a good price, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Meyneang's Group

texts.en:
Meyneang is 38 years old and widowed. She has three children, two of whom are her dependents and still in school. Meyneang comes from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district. She earns a living by selling various kinds of fruits, and she has been in this business for 15 years.

This is the first loan for Meyneang’s group of two members, with VisionFund. Meyneang, the group leader, wants to use her loan portion to buy more fruits to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to resell

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal, originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, is 36 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice to feed and support her family members. She also grows corn to earn additional income for her family. Having been in this business for 13 years, she is able to earn about 16,000 riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Phal has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid her past loan. The other members have been with VisionFund for three to seven cycles. Phal used her past loans smartly to gradually improve her life. Now Phal, who is leading her group of five to ask for a loan, will use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her cultivated land. She hopes to grow more rice and corn so as to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her cultivated land

loans.name: Silena

texts.es: Silena de 29 años de edad tiene un taller de confecciones en el barrio que la vio nacer y donde ha logrado hacer poco a poco su clientela, desde que aprendiera con su madre el oficio de la confección hace aproximadamente 15 años, moviéndose entre telas y maquinarias en la modistería ubicada en casa de su madre. Sus principales productos son las blusas, faldas y vestidos femeninos y últimamente vestidos de baño, enfocándose un poco hacia los textiles de punto.  Ella ha ido pasando de un mercado doméstico a uno conformado por comerciantes independientes, que venden sus productos y también ganan dinero. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas e insumos de confecciones en un mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos y lograr un aumento de su producción, sosteniéndose en el mercado con buenos precios. Su meta es ampliar su estructura contratar operarias y está trabajando en el incremento de su mercado, para avanzar hacia ese propósito y finalmente tener su propia vivienda que es su sueño principal.
texts.en: Silena is 29 years old and has a tailoring workshop in the neighborhood where she was born. Little by little, she has increased her clients since she learned tailoring in her mother's office fifteen years ago, moving between clothes and machines in the shop in her mother's house. Her main products are blouses, skirts, feminine dresses, and recently bathing suits, focusing a bit on point textiles. She has gone through the domestic market and is in one made by independent sellers which sell her products and also gain money. Now she is applying for a kiva loan, her first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy cloth and tailoring supplies in high volume to gain discounts and augment her production, sustaining herself in the market with good prices. Her goal is to expand her operation structure and she is working on increasing her market to advance toward this goal and finally have her own home, which is her biggest dream.

loans.use: to buy clothes and tailoring supplies in high volume

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto elaboró artesanías con una mejor calidad comprando insumos en un mayor volumen y está muy satisfecho porque tiene mayor inventario y esto fue gracias a su credikiva. En l actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento con el cual comprará materias primas para elaborar bolsos y hamacas y también comprará mercancía variada aprovechando la experiencia de este nuevo mercado para él. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Estoy muy agradecido por los créditos recibidos y espero seguir trabajando con esta entidad: “
texts.en:
Humberto made better quality handicrafts by buying supplies in bulk, and is very satisfied because he has greater inventory. This was thanks to his credikiva loan. 

Currently he is applying for new loan that he will use to buy materials for making bags and hammocks. He will also buy a variety of merchandise, taking advantage of his experience in this new market. 

His message to the Kiva lenders is the following, "I am very grateful for the loans received, and I hope to continue working with this organization."

loans.use: To buy materials for making bags and hammocks,and also to buy a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Noerm's Group

texts.en:
Noerm, 50, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Thmor Koul district. She has four children. To make a living, she has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland for six years. The current business earns her family about 23,000 riels (KHR) per day.

Noerm’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She is in her first cycle with VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her field business so as to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Efren

texts.es:
El Sr Efren  es de Ciudad del Este, está casado con la Sra. Teresa con quien tiene 2  hijos menores  que aún están cursando la escuela primaria. Ambos son comerciantes tiene una despensa en su casa donde ambos trabajan juntos y se ayudan por salir adelante.
El producto que más venden son los masivos; azúcar, leche, arroz y aceite ya que su local comercial está en muy buena ubicación en la zona.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando educa a sus hijos, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de arroz, fideo, leche, azúcar, verduras, carnes y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas y seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes. En la foto de la historia está con la Sra. Teresa quien es su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Efren is from Ciudad del Este. He is married to Sra. Teresa and they have two young children who are in primary school. Both he and his wife are merchants who manage a food pantry in their home. They work together and help another so that they can move forward. The products that they sell the most are offered in bulk such as sugar, milk, rice, and oil. Their shop is established in a good location within their district. Thanks to their work, they are able to provide an education for their children and buy everything they need for the home.

Efren is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, noodles, milk, sugar, vegetables, meat, and other products so that he can continue making sales and offering variety to his customers. In the photo, he is seen with his wife Sra. Teresa.

loans.use: to buy milk, noodles, milk, sugar, vegetables, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Ledis

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, ledis compró mercancias varias que favorecieron su negocio porque sintió que sus ganancias aumentaron. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ropa para diversificar su mercancia y no solo vender los productos mediante guias especializadas. Ella envia un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: " Me parece muy buena la oportunidad que me dieron en mi negocio y en mi vida en general. Y esto es lo que Leidis agradece mucho.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva Loan, Ledis bought several types of merchandise to boost her business because she felt she needed to increase her earnings. She is currently applying for another Kiva loan because she wants to buy clothes in order to diversify her inventory. Ledis wants to sell items in addition to those offered through specialized catalogs.

She sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “I am very pleased with the opportunity you have given to my business and to my life in general.” For this reason, Ledis expresses great appreciation.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hy's Group

texts.en:
Hy is age 28 and married with two children. Her family lives in a village in the Thmor Koul Dambae district of Battambang province. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and working as a paid worker in the area to earn additional income for the family. The current business earns her about 30,000 riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs.

Hy is taking out her first microloan with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also use a portion of it to spend on pumping water. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San José está conformado por 8 integrantes, siete mujeres y 1 hombre, padres  y madres responsables con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Estas personas se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Lo cual lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.


La coordinadora del banco comunal San José es Floribel y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible y en cantidades pequeñas como caja de fosforo, sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, huevos, pan, jabón, detergente. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal San José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank San José is made of 8 members, 7 women and one man, fathers and mothers who are responsable for 20 children. They come from Sauce, a place located in the western zone of the country. These people are characterized by being responsible, hardworking, and with the desire to personally rise. This is what they fight for day by day - to bring a better future to their children.

The Communal Bank coordinator is Floribel and she works at a convenience shop, a small shop that sells food products in small quantities like boxes of matches, instant coffee packets, shampoo packets, salsa packets, rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, soap, and detergent, which is located in her house. She dedicates herself to her business, offering products for 12 hours daily. The objective of this loan is to invest in work capital and stock her business so that in the not so distant future she can make better earnings. The communal bank San José is grateful for the help from the financiers from Kiva, which provide the people with a few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have the means to make a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her convenience shop with the purchase of food products like boxes of matches, instant coffee packets, shampoo packets, salsa packets, rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, soap, and detergent.

loans.name: Phoerng's Group

texts.en:
Phoerng, 54, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Moung Russey district. She has five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for several years. Her current business earns her family about 22,000 riels (KHR) per day.

There are two members in Phoerng’s group. Phoerng is taking out her forth microloan with VisionFund, while the other member has just been with VisionFund for one cycle. Phoerng is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also use a portion of it to spend on labor costs and water pumping. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Martha Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Martha habita en e l municipio de Ticuantepe en la comunidad llamada San pedro, junto a su esposo trabajan la tierra desde hace muchos años, su mayor sueño es darle a sus hijos un mejor porvenir y mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella cultiva Pitahaya y actualmente requiere darle un mantenimiento optimo a su cultivo, con este nuevo credito comprara los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatir las  plagas de sus cultivos, Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha lives in the community of San Pedro, which is in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She and her husband have worked the land together for many years. Her greatest wish is to provide her children a better future and improved living conditions.

Martha grows dragon fruit and currently wants to keep her crop in optimal condition. With this new loan, she will buy fertilizers and the necessary supplies for combatting pests. She is grateful for the support from AFODENIC and the Kiva funds that have been issued.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Bunhan's Group

texts.en:
Bunhan, 53, is married with four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, and the main sources of her family’s income are from raising pigs and distilling alcohol. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about 70,000 KHR per day and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day. 

Bunhan has been with VisionFund for five cycles and has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. Bunhan wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and also hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Young's Group

texts.en:
Young is aged 50 and married. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Living in a village of the Ek Phnom district, Young farms rice, while her husband works as a paid construction worker in the local area to earn additional income for the family. Having been in the business for 34 years, she manages to earn about 38,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to feed her family and children. 

This is the seventh loan for Young with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past six loans, which have enabled her to support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of four to request a loan. As the leader, Young will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from the rice paddy to improve her income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Varn's Group

texts.en:
Varn is aged 55 years old and widowed. She lives with two sons in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She has been raising pigs for almost 30 years. The current business earns her family about 33,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

This is the second loan for Varn with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy piglets for raising. She hopes to raise her pigs to be healthy so as to sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria invirtió su anterior credikiva en útiles escolares, hamacas industriales y cobijas térmicas. Ella estuvo muy satisfecha con su financiamiento y dice que son muy buenos, porque no son costosos, puede renovar las mercancías en exhibición porque cuenta con un fondo de efectivo y se encuentra  muy agradecida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa femenina, ropa de cama y cortinas, las cuales tiene encargadas por su clientela.
texts.en:
Maria invested her previous Kiva loan in school supplies, industrial hammocks, and thermal blankets. She was very pleased with the loan and says that the results were good because her products were not costly. Maria was able to replenish her merchandise on display because she had cash on hand. For this reason, she is very grateful.

Maria is currently applying for another Kiva loan so that she can buy women’s clothing, bed sheets, and curtains. These items have been ordered by her customers.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothing, bed sheets, and curtains.

loans.name: Hoerb's Group

texts.en:
Hoerb, 48, is from a rural village located in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is married with three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice on 2 hectares of farmland and through fishing. They have been in this business for six years. The current business earns her family about 70,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

Hoerb’s group is receiving a microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she is a first-time borrower. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 600,000 KHR each, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for water pumping. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income to set aside some money to buy a water pumping machine to help her in the rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
Washington tiene 49 años de edad su estado civil casado vive con su esposo tiene 2 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos

La VRC  Solidaria, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Gabriel, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Washington se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 


Yo cambiaria mi negocio con el apoyo del préstamo trabajando más  en mis cultivo

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es comprarse un terreno. 

Los desafíos a los que enfrenta  es  a las plagas y cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Washington is 49 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Solidaria” is located in the neighborhood of San Gabriel in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farmers and ranchers.

Washington is a farmer who grows corn. He is requesting a loan in order to buy urea, liquid weed killer, and insecticides. Washington switched over into this line of work, so this loan will help him focus more on his crops. With these funds, he will be able to buy what he needs for his farming activities. His purchases are conducted in Ventanas. Washington’s dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenges he faces include dealing with pests and maintaining his crops.

In his free time, Washington enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid weed killer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Phoeng's Group

texts.en:
Phoeng is aged 25 and married with one daughter. His family lives in a village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. He and his wife earn a living through working as a teacher and farming rice. Having been in this business for five years, he is able to earn approximately 9,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet his family’s needs. 

Phoeng is an existing client of VisionFund who has received loans for one loan cycle. The past loan helped him relieve the family's financial burden to a great extent. He is now leading a group of three members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to make more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living to send his daughter to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hol

texts.en:
Hol, 44, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Srey Snom district. She has three children, one of whom is still dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for almost 20 years, and the current business earns her family about 25,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. She manages to save about 18,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Hol has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan. The previous loan has enabled her to better support her family as well as her current business. Hol will use her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Dutezimbere Ubuhinzi Ii .a Group

texts.fr:
Adèle ( la prémiere à gauche) est agé de 56 ans,et a 5 enfants dont le olus agé a 30 ans et le moins agé a 19 ans.elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les angrais chimiques et payer le main d`oeuvre.elle n`attend aucune difficulte pour le remboursement.

le stratégie pour la croissance de son affaire est de demander d`autre prêt pour financer son business.ses ambitions pour son affaire est d`être le meilleur agriculteur des maïs et pour sa famille c`est éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adèle (standing on the left in the picture) is 56 years old and has five children. The eldest is 30 years old, the youngest is 19.

She's seeking a loan in order to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor. She doesn't foresee any difficulty in repaying this loan.

Her strategy to grow her business consists in seeking other loans to finance it.

In her business, she ambitions to be the best corn farmer. For her family, her ambition is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
Vuth, aged 31, is married and lives with his family in a village of the Srey Snom district. He has three children to take care of who are still in school. To make a living, he has been farming rice for thirteen years, and currentlt the business earns his family about 20,000KHR per day.

Vuth’s group consists of two members. He is leading his group to apply to a loan. As the leader, Vuth wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on water pumping. He hopes this loan will enable him to get a high yield from his farm, so that he can make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Bocar Sidiki

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bocar Sidiki est un homme marié de 36 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il vit avec ses femmes et ses enfants chez son père à Bougouni dans le quartier Dialanicoro.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, pendant des années il s’adonne à l’apprentissage de la conduite de camionnettes  auprès d’un ami. Quelques années  il obtient son permis de conduire et commence à faire le chauffeur. C’est au cours de son activité de chauffeur qu’il trouve son fonds de roulement pour débuter son commerce  de céréales et de légumes, qui est aujourd’hui son activité première, grâce à la rentabilité de cette activité.
Depuis 3 ans il ne mène que  les activités de la vente des céréales et de légumes.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un ami qui est une client Soro Yiriwaso, il décide de rejoindre l’institution  pour acheter  4 tonnes de diverses céréales. Il s’approvisionne à Manankoro et Gueya. Il est à première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                                                                                                                      La vente se fait au marché de Bougouni et une partie à Bamako.
Monsieur Bocar Sidiki compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices il envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Bocar Sidiki is 36 years old and the father of two children. He lives with his wives and children at his father's home in the Dialanicoro neighborhood of Bougouni.

He did not go to modern school, and for years he dedicated himself to learning how to drive delivery vans along with a friend. After a few years, he earned his driver's license and started to work as a driver. 

It was during this time that he found the working capital to start his grain and vegetable business. Due to its profitability, this business is his primary business today. For the past three years, this has also been his only business.

A friend who is a client of Soro Yiriwaso introduced him to the institution, and he decided to join in order to buy four tons of various grains. He buys his supplies in Manankoro et Gueya. This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. He sells his goods at the Bougouni market and in an area of Bamako.

Monsieur Bocar Sidiki would like to earn monthly revenues of 50,000 FCFA. With the profits, he would like to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Adjélé

texts.fr: Adjélé est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. Adjélé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des boissons dans son bar pour tous clients. Elle achète les produits à Lomé et travaille avec une personne. Adjélé a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années,Adjélé voudrait agrandir son bar et revendre des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: Adjélé is a 29-year-old woman. She is unmarried and without children. Adjélé has been working as a retailer since 2008. She sells beverages in her bar to any customer. She purchases her goods in Lomé and works with one person. Adjélé has requested a second WAGES loan to purchase some beverages. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Adjélé would like to expand her bar and sell grocery items. She says that, with the profits, she plans on supporting herself.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to sell

loans.name: Sovan's Group

texts.en:
A rice grower from Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sovan is also one of the breadwinners in the family, which consists of three children. Besides working on a rice farm as the primary source of income, she also sells cooked rice while her husband works for others for a fee.  She has been involved in the current business for eighteen years. 

Sovan is in her fifth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully paid back, have empowered her to progressively improve her living standards. Now, she is part of a group of three, who are applying for a group loant totalling 3,600,000 KHR. 

Sovan is the group leader. She will use her loan portion of 1,200,000 KHR to buy petrol for pumping water and potash for her rice farm. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so that she can sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy petrol for pumping water and potash for her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
Thol is a widowed mother of three children. She cares for her daughter who is still in school.

She manages one hectare of farmland on which she grows cassava. She has been engaged in this business for ten years. This business returns her about 18,000 KHR per day. 

She has previously had four loan cycles with Kiva’s partner. She has used her past loans to support her business and maintain her living. For this cycle, she is the leader of a group composed of two female. Both members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. Thol will use her portion of the loan to pay for plowing, weeding, and labor costs. She hopes that her crop will grow well and provide her with ahigh yield.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, and labor costs for her cassava farm.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Afin d’ouvrir une autre boutique de produits de beauté et entretenir sa famille, Ayélé fait son premier prêt à WAGES. Elle est maman d’un adorable enfant d’01an, a pour conjoint un mécanicien et est âgée de 26ans. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et en même temps revendeuse de produits de beauté depuis 2004.
texts.en:
To open another shop of beauty products and support her family, Ayélé obtained her first credit loan from WAGES.

She is the mother of an adorable one-year-old child, and her spouse is a 26-year-old mechanic. She is a hairdresser by profession and at the same time a retailer of beauty products since 2004.

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Wend Teldo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  ISSA représente le  groupe WEND TELDO. Mr se porte bien. Marié, Il est père de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgés à 07mois. 02 vont  à l’école et il a 05 personnes  en charge.
Mr vend de pagnes DANFANI depuis 15 ans.  Il s’approvisionne à kouritenga et à paglayuiri. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  20 pagnes tissé.
Il  veut renforcer son activité  avec ses bénéfices. Mr ambitionne agrandir son hagard au marché et mieux instruire ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa represents the Wend Teldo group. He is doing well: he is married and the father of four children. The eldest is 12 years old and youngest is seven months old. Two go to school and he has five persons to care for.

He has been selling Danfani pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for 15 years. He gets his supplies from Kouritenga and Paglayuiri. His customers are both men and women.

He wants to buy 20 woven pagnes, and strengthen his business with his profits.  His aim is to expand his stall at the market and improve his children's education.

loans.use: buy 20 woven pagnes.

loans.name: Naved Iqbal

texts.en: Mr. Naved Iqbal owns a small embroidery business in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a 35-year-old hard working and honest man and a responsible father of four children. His children are students. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing a variety of embroidery materials including threads, needles, beads, buttons etc. But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to purchase the needful things. Therefore, he has requested a loan of 100,000PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of embroidery materials including threads, needles, beads etc

loans.name: Karpala Group

texts.fr:
Mme ADISSA est responsable du groupe  KARPALA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 34ans et le moins âgés à 19 ans. 01 vont  à l’école et elle a 05 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend de la farine de manioc (placalie) et des chaussures depuis 28ans.  Elle s’approvisionne à Abidjan. Ses clients sont les femmes et les revendeurs du marché de sankayaaré.
Elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs de farine de manioc (placalie).
Elle  veut avec  ses bénéfices renforcer son activité. Mme  ambitionne toujours épargner et veut toujours contruire une maison d’habitation sur sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Ms. Adissa is the person responsible for the Karpala group. She is doing well: she is married and the mother of five children. The eldest is 34 and the youngest 19 years old. One of them attends school and she has five people under her care.

She has been selling cassava flour (placalie) and shoes for 28 years. She resupplies in Abidjan. Her clients are women and retailers from the Sankayaaré market.

She wants to buy 10 bags of cassava flour (placalie) and strengthen her business with her profits. Her ambition has always been to save so that she can build a house on her plot of land.

loans.use: buy 10 bags of cassava flour (placalie).

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is 29 years old, and is a single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employee with a low salary that he makes an effort to use to provide for himself and his family. His relatives are proud of him because he is a person who faced the difficult situations that happened to him. 

He intends to buy furniture for his house but he doesn't have enough money so he applied for a youth loan of 199,999.92 YER from AMB to buy furniture. He wishes to improve his living standards and get married.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Al-Raja'a Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Raja'a, which consists of four ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. They applied for a loan of YER 80,000 to buy incense and perfume.

Fatima is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She lives in Hodeida,Yemen. She is working hard to help her family. She has been selling incense and perfume for three years to assist her husband because he could not cover all the living expenses of his family. She intends to expand her business to increase her profits, so she applied for a loan of YER 20,000 from AMB to buy more incense and perfume.

Fatima looks forward to improving her family's living conditions and enroll her children in private schools to have better education.

loans.use: to buy incense and pefume to resell.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a very hard-working person. Above all, she is very responsible. She says that thanks for the previous Kiva loan; she has been able to gradually improve her business, and it is continually growing. Her goal is to expand her business and to also be able to give work to other people.

She is requesting a new loan to buy a freezer that she will use in her ice-making shop. She is grateful for the new opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman who lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya. She has three children who all attend school. Eunice operates a timber-selling business and she has been in this business for the last six years. She previously worked as a vegetable vendor. Due to the lack of enough capital to satisfy all her customers, Eunice is applying for a loan of KES 50,000. This will enable her to purchase more timber for resale, thus increasing her income to be able to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He describes himself to be God fearing, social and talkative. He operates a motorcycle with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy eggs and milk for starting a new retail business . His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy milk and eggs for a starting a new retail business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is grateful for her previous loan; it was of great help to boost her business and grow her business. She has requested a loan amounting to Ksh. 50,000 to pay school fees for her children. She hopes this will help her clear school fees for her children and ensure full study for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en: This is 29-year-old Santigie. He is married and has two children aged seven and five. He has no additional dependents. In 2006, Santigie established his drinks and provisions business. He began his business to improve his livelihood and the family. His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are the general community. Working seven days a week and 17 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Santigie has already received and successfully repaid his first loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more drinks, biscuits, sardines, luncheon meat etc. He hopes that this loan will help the business to expand. In the future, Santigie plans to develop some land, give a quality education to the children and expand the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Ekezel

texts.en:
Ekezel is 37 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia. He is married and has two children, ages 4 and 7 respectively. They are in school and live at home. He went to high school. 

He spends nine hours on his business. Since 2008 he has been running a shop where he sells underclothes. He has a lot of customers, and his daily sales are very high, especially during the dry season. He is requesting a loan to purchase more underclothes for his business. He plans to expand his business and build a store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more underclothes for his business.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 30000 to boost her food stall business. She’s requesting finance in order to have larger working capital to offer a much larger variety of goods to her customers. With the loan she will purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

Her goal is to have a stable business to be able to offer a better future to her children.

Mwanahawa is very grateful to lenders who have offered support so she can have a means of work that’s worthy of them.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Alimamy.  He is married and has 2 children aged 5 and 1 year, and one is a school-going child.

In 2011, Alimamy established his mobile phone and accessories business. He began his business because he dropped out of school because of lack of sponsorship.  He joined his brother's business, who supplied him with patent medicines to be sold and paid back at a particular cost.  He did it for some years and the commission he got was used to start his own business. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 1,836,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Alimamy requires a loan in order to buy chargers, mobile phones, memory cards, phone screens, phone speakers and phone batteries. In the future, Alimamy plans to educate his children, open a shop and build a house.  This loan will help to buy more stock and maximize profits.  Sometimes he can buy phones that may be faulty.  He is an honest and trustworthy business man.  He thanks you and ARD for supporting his business.

loans.use: to buy chargers, mobile phones, memory cards, phone screens, phone speakers and phone batteries

loans.name: Mchenzala

texts.en: Mchenzala is 36 years old, and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in Samburu, Kenya. She lives in her own house with solar power but without tapped water. She owns and operates a clothes selling stall. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy bundles of second-hand clothes. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 4 children. She has received no formal education. Esi sells kenkey (a traditional corn based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). She has been selling kenkey for 16 years. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to help support her husband in paying the family’s general expenses and their children's school fees. Esi will use the loan to purchase more corn to prepare greater quantities of kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to increase her working capital and further expand her kenkey business.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda sells rice and saucepans in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). Linda has received some formal education till the equivalent of junior high school. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a welder. Linda has been selling rice and saucepans for three years. She helps her husband pay their family's general expenses. 

Her loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of rice to sell in the market as well as an increased quantity and variety of saucepans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her petty trading operations.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of rice to sell in the market as well as an increased quantity and variety of saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a single businessman and runs an entertainment spot, basically renting out musical instruments. His main challenge is lack of finance – a problem he sees partly sorted by this loan.

Leonard learnt about Milango through advertisements and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Leonard is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase a box speaker and microphones. He believes that the business has improved enough to meet the required repayments for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a box speaker and microphones.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 10 and 21 who are in school. They all live in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County that is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market.  

She was unable to attend school, and has been selling palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc., in the local market for the past 10 years. She uses a motorbike to get her goods, so she really faces a problem during the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory (palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc.) before the rainy season. Her dream is to build a house for her children and to boost her business because it has gained her independence.

loans.use: to increase her inventory (palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc.) before the rainy season.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells maize and garden eggs in Akonoma (near Cape Coast). Aba has received no formal education. she is widow with four children. 

Aba has been selling maize and garden eggs for 20 years. She is responsible for supporting herself and her children whilst saving for their futures. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables to sell in the market. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her vegetable selling trade and possibly build a stand.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells kenkey (a traditional corn-based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma, near Cape Coast. Ekua has received no formal education. She is married and her husband is a teacher. Ekua has been selling kenkey for 10 years. She helps her husband pay for their general expenses, and they lend support to their adult children whenever they can. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to prepare her kenkey recipe. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her kenkey trade.

loans.use: to buy more corn to prepare her kenkey recipe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Dolphine

texts.en: Dolphine is a 25-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be a patient, visionary, and ambitious woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services such as blowdrying, plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located near a bus station, and her primary customers are the local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a hairdryer. Her business goal is to open two more beauty salons within five years.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Virgen del Carmen está en su ciclo número Quinto   del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Dos de las miembros de este grupo en su última encuesta mostraron estar por debajo de la línea.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Maria comenta que trabaja en la venta de ropa, y que por medio de ese esfuerzo quiere salir adelante. Lucha día a día de manera imparable ya que quiere que su familia tenga todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Maria solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, ya que quiere poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, ya que esta es la única forma que tiene  de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen del Carmen" is in its fifth loan cycle through the women's program.  All of the members work and help each other get ahead.  On the last poverty survey, two of the members showed they are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Maria who was at level one on the poverty survey.  Maria says she works selling clothing and has been able to get ahead through her business.  She works hard every day because she wants her family to have things she was unable to have.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of clothing because she wants to continue investing in her business.  This is the only way she has of prospering and helping her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kuarahy Rese Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuarahy Rese está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan para ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo dar a sus familias todo lo que está a su alcance.
La Sra. Constancia, una de las miembros, tiene un pequeño copetín donde vende todo, como ser comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y demás. Ella se esfuerza día a día y cuenta que su sueño es poder tener un día un gran local donde pueda tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia y crecer como persona y microempresaria.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, golosinas e insumos para poder seguir teniendo su copetín bien completo, ya que este es su medio de ayudar a su familia y de darles todo lo que puede.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuarahy Rese" is on its fifth loan cycle through the women's program.  The members help each other mutually and, through their work, provide everything they can for their families.

Constancia, one of the members, has a small store where she sells everything such as soft drinks, sweets and other items.  She works hard every day and says her goal is to have a large store some day so she can increase her income and help her family.  She wants to grow as a person and as a small businesswoman.

She is requesting this loan to be able to continue keeping her store well-stocked since this is how she supports her family and gives them everything she can.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado María Auxiliadora está en su ciclo número 10, donde 5 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, es decir, se encuentran en el nivel rojo del semáforo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marlene, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno.  Marlene se dedica a hacer comidas rápidas para la venta, cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y a sus clientes les gusta mucho. Es una persona que siempre ha trabajo y lo sigue haciendo por ayudar a su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende, como ser verduras, condimentos, aderezos, carnes y demás. Agradece por la gran oportunidad que recibe, pues podrá seguir con su plan de trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Auxiliadora" is in its tenth loan cycle and five of the members are below the poverty line, meaning they are at level red of the "traffic light".

One of the members is Marlene who was at level one on the last poverty survey.  She sells fast food for a living and claims to have a very good customer base as her food is very good and popular.  She is someone who has always worked and continues to do so to help her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make the food she sells, such as vegetables, condiments, seasonings, meat and other items.  She is grateful for this opportunity because she will able to continue with her work plans.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, condiments, seasonings, meat and other items.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo es un hombre trabajador, este es su primer crédito el cual usará para comprar una motocicleta. Necesita de seiscientos mil colones (600.000) para poder comprarla. Esto le ayudará a transportarse al lugar de trabajo, el cual esta a muchos kilómetros de distancia y con esto poder tener mas tiempo libre para disfrutar con su familia.
texts.en: Gustavo is a hard-working man who is requesting his first loan to buy a motorcycle.  He needs 600,000 CRC to buy it.  This will help him get to work, which is many kilometers away, and give him more time able to spend with his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Wendsongdo Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est responsable du groupe WENDSONGDO. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgés à 14 ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des condiments et de la farine depuis 26ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les voisins (hommes, femmes et les enfants). 
Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs de maïs et 12 plats de gombo sec. 
Elle veut avec ses bénéfices renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne aider son mari dans les charges familiales et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the WENDSONGDO group.  She is married and the mother of six children between the ages of 26 and 14.  One of her children goes to school.  Mariam also supports six additional persons.

She has been selling condiments and flour for 26 years.  She stocks up at the market in her district and resells to her neighbors (men, women and children).

She wants to buy three bags of maize and 12 bowls of dry gumbo (okra).

She wants to use her profits to strengthen her activity.  Her ambition is to support her husband with the family's expenses and to take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of maize and 12 bowls of dry gumbo (okra).

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Lili  es una mujer carismática y luchadora , esta divorciada del padre de sus 02 hijos,  con quienes vive en su casa propia, la cual fue comprada con mucho esfuerzo.Lili se dedica a la venta de libros, pasamanerías y artículos de bazar, razón por la cual cuenta con un local en la casa de su mamá, de esa manera se ahorra en gastos de alquiler, su negocio está siendo muy concurrida por los vecinos , a quienes  atiende con amabilidad.  Su librería lleva más de 07 años de funcionamiento, tiempo que le valió para  ser muy conocida en su localidad, contando con el apoyo de su madre para la atención al público.
Le gusta su trabajo porque le ha traído los ingresos económicos que le dan la tranquilidad a su familia, comenta que escogió esta actividad por la necesidad de contar con un oficio y sentirse una mujer productiva, por tanto  tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar  su negocio.Este es el  préstamo número 03 con Kiva ,por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes.
Con el préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará  útiles escolares como cuadernos , lapiceros , borradores n entre otros y útiles de bazar a un precio mas cómodo ya que considera que a mayor variedad más acogida tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Lili is a charismatic, hard-working woman who is divorced from the father of her two children who live with her in their own home bought through much effort.  Lili sells books, home textiles and bazaar items out of a shop in her mother's house, so she is able to save on rental expenses.  Her business is very popular among the neighbors and she attends them with kindness.  Her bookstore has been in business for over seven years so she has become very well-known in the town.  Her mother helps her attend to customers.

She likes her work because she is able to earn a living and give her family a calm existence.  She chose this activity because she needed a job and to feel like a productive person.  So she is determined to continue growing the business.  

This is her third Kiva loan and she is counting on your help so she can reach her goals.  She will use the 1,500 PEN to buy school supplies, such as notebooks, pencils and erasers, and bazaar items at low prices, since she believes the more variety she offers the better sales will go.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and bazaar items.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur. Elle a trois enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Le premier est âgé de 25ans et le dernier a 18ans. Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1992. Elle vend du charbon de bois, des tubercules d’ignames et des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à LOME et a l’intérieur de pays et travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes. Afi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois, des tubercules d’ignames et des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi is 48 years old and married to a driver.  She has three children, one of whom goes to school.  Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 18.

Afi has been working as a reseller since 1992.  She sells charcoal, yam tubers and grains from her home, to a wide range of customers.  She buys her goods in Lomé and in the country's interior. She works alone.  Currently, her major difficulty is that she cannot satisfy all the demand from her customers.

She has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal, yam tubers and grains.  She wants to reinvest in her activity.  In the coming years, she would like to increase the size of her business.  She says that she is planning to use her profits to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal, yam tubers and maize.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo de 54 años de edad, lleva más de 40 años de experiencia comercializando pescado en su localidad. Desde niño se dedicó a esta actividad, ya que por la condición económica de su familia no tuvo la oportunidad de acceder a la educación y debió asumir las responsabilidades del hogar.
Comenzó vendiendo pescado en una pequeña caja de icopor, por las calles de su barrio; con su esfuerzo y años de trabajo ahorró para comprar un vehículo que le permitiera expandir su nicho de mercado, Hoy distribuye su producto en diferentes municipios del departamento de Antioquia, Colombia.
Debido al mal estado del vehículo Luis se vio en la obligación de suspender la venta de su producto, situación que lo ha perjudicado considerablemente por que esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para realizar las reparaciones correspondientes y reactivar su actividad económica, garantizándole a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo, 54, has worked selling fish for over 40 years in his locality. He started this line of work already as a child, since he could not study due to his family’s economic condition and had to take charge of the home’s responsibilities.

Luis Eduardo started selling fish in his neighborhood with a polystyrene container. With effort and time, he saved money and bought a vehicle that allowed him to expand his reach. He is now distributing his products in different municipalities of the Antioquia department, in Colombia.

His vehicle is in bad shape, so Luis had to stop the distribution of his products. This situation has considerably harmed his economy, since this is his only source of income and the way he supports his wife and four children. This is why he is requesting a loan to fix his car and restart with his activities in order to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to fix his car and be able to continue selling fish in it.

loans.name: Lydiya

texts.ru:
Лидия уже пользовалась финансовой помощью КИВА. Предыдущий кредит она брала на закупку весенней коллекции одежды на продажу. Полученная от КИВА сумма помогла ей выставить достаточно товара на весну. Особых трудностей со времени получения последнего кредита не было, хотя немного снизилась покупательская способность. Расширения в бизнесе в принципе не наблюдалось, зато она смогла купить сыну квартиру, а также бытовую технику и мебель для этой квартиры. 
В этот раз она обратилась за суммой в размере 11 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить детские рубашки, юбки, платья, легкие весенние куртки, свитера и кофточки. Весна сулит прибыль, так как покупатели активизируются в поисках покупок. И, чтобы их не упустить, надо иметь хорошее, достойное рыночное предложение.
texts.en:
Lydiya has used financial assistance from Kiva before.  She took a previous loan to buy an assortment of clothes for resale.  The money she received from Kiva helped her to display enough merchandise for the spring.  She did not experience any particular difficulties during her previous loan, although her purchasing capacity decreased a little.  In general, she did not see an increase in her business, but she was able to buy an apartment as well as household appliances for her son.

This time, she has requested a loan of 11,000 hryvnia in order to purchase children's shirts, skirts, dresses, light spring jackets, sweaters and blouses.  The spring promises to bring profits, as people intensify their shopping.  And in order not to let them slip by, one needs to offer a good, decent market supply.

loans.use: to buy children's shirts, skirts, dresses, light spring jackets, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Luz Miryam

texts.es:
Luz Miryam de 50 años, Asegura que su mayor prioridad es el bienestar de su familia. “mi esfuerzo, luchas y necesidades, son recompensadas por el gran amor que mis hijos me transmiten cada día. Cuando llego a casa y veo en sus rostros una sonrisa, me doy cuenta que todo lo que he hecho ha valido la pena” Con estas palabras Luz, narra la motivación que le genera su familia para sacarlos adelante y velar por un mejor futuro para ellos. 
Por su condición de soltera, le ha tocado ser madre y padre a la vez, lo que ha implicado rebuscarse la vida a fin de garantizarles a sus hijos alimentación y vivienda.
Gracias a su esfuerzo, Luz logró montar una tienda en su residencia lo que le permitió cuidar de sus hijos y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento del hogar. Hoy considera que su negocio ha sido el más grande regalo que Dios ha podido brindarle ya que gracias a él, nunca ha tenido que padecer de hambre.
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su negocio y por ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de productos de la canasta familiar con el fin de aumentar su nivel de ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Espera seguir creciendo como microempresaria y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Miryam, 50, says that her greatest priority is her family's well-being. "My effort, my struggle and needs are rewarded by the great love which my children give me every day. When I get home and see a smile on their faces, I realize that everything I've done has been worth it." With these words, Luz narrates the motivation that her family gives her in order to move forward and work towards a better future for them.

Due to her condition as a single mother, Luz has had to be both mother and father to her children, which created the need to search for a source of income to guarantee food and housing for her children.

Thanks to her efforts, Luz managed to open a store in her home, which allowed her to take care of her children and generate the income necessary to sustain her household. She believes that her business has been the greatest gift which God could have given her, because thanks to this business, she has never had to suffer from hunger.

Her greatest dream is to see her business grow, which is why she has applied for a loan. She will use this loan to buy staple goods in order to increase her level of sales and improve her earnings. She hopes to continue growing as a small businesswoman and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Luz Divina está conformado por 8 integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad.
