They have two children who are still studying. Rosa currently lives with her husband and children in the Abrahan Calazacón parish in Santo Domingo, the main city of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, an area which has very strong commerce as it has become a terrestrial port for trade between the mountains and the coast in Ecuador. In addition, domestic and foreign tourists have strengthened the activities of the entrepreneurs who set up their business around the city several years ago. This city is the third most populated in the region and it also contributes to activities such as agriculture, cattle rearing, fishery and manufacturing.

For the last four years, Rosa has been making her living in agriculture. She learnt this honorable trade from her parents who were also farmers. She spends a lot of her time in the mornings and the afternoons alternating between the household chores. She is always caring for her crops, watering, cleaning, harvesting and sowing in order to offer the goods to her customers at good prices.

The biggest obstacle that Rosa has faced is the difficulty in authenticating the land in which she works. However, she has continued to work hard to support the household and support her children's education. Rosa has been a customer of the Fundación Alternativa for four years and she has had a lot of openings with the 3 loans she has taken out. Rosa is very satisfied with the agility and support given to micro-entrepreneurs in the rural sector, as it is only in this manner that she has been able to keep the farm and her crops in such good condition.

Rosa now needs a loan which she will use to repair the internal and external infrastructure of her home and also buy fertilizers for the upkeep of her crops. Rosa thanks everyone who has been financing her growth on a personal and work front via Kiva. She will always work to achieve her dream and that of her husband – to see their children become upstanding professionals.

loans.use: to do up her home and repair the farm.

loans.name: Elena Petrona

texts.es: La Sra. Elena tiene 37 años, casada con 5 hijos que tienen las edades de 1, 3, 10, 13 y 18 años, ella se dedica a la venta de enaguas y polleras  para mujeres de polleras, ella vende en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro la institución, La Sra. Elena va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una computadora para sus hijos ya que el mayor salió ya de colegio y necesita para sus estudios universitarios y el dinero le será de gran utilidad, ya que lo utilizara en gastos personales y si tiene un saldo lo utilizara en la compra de ropa para surtir su puesto de venta,   La Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería,  La Sra. Elena es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old and has five children, ages 1, 3, 10, 13 and 18.  She sells petticoats and skirts for women in various markets in the city of La Paz, Bolivia.  This is her first loan with Kiva partner Emprender.  

Elena will use this loan to purchase a computer for her children.  Her oldest has already graduated from high school and needs the computer for his university studies.  The loan will be very useful in paying for personal expenses as well.  If there are any remaining funds, they will be used to buy clothing to stock her stall.

Elena faces challenges in her business that include maintaining sufficient inventory.  Elena is a very hardworking person who is happy for this opportunity; her business is the only activity that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her son.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Residing in Pursat Province, Sophal is 33 years old and married. She has two children who are students in a local state school.  She manages one and half hectares of rice farmland while her husband works as a police officer. She has worked in her current business for 22 years, and it has returned her about 17,400 KHE per day. Sophal is a four-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is pleased with her past loan, which has afforded her the opportunity to cover her daily cost of living and especially decent food for her kids. She also managed to repay her past loan. Now she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. The total of her group loan is 5,400,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to renovate her house. She hopes to own a proper house for her family.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Glenda Lismenia

texts.es: Glenda, es Casada tiene un hijo de 5 años, ella tiene una libreria y tambien tiene una venta de de calzado, inicio su negocio hace 2 años, y gracias a Dios poco a poco ella a ido creciendo en su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para su libreria espera que por medio de ustedes ella pueda seguir luchando en su negocio y asi salir adelante.
texts.en: Glenda is married with a five-year-old son.  She owns a bookstore and also sells shoes.  Two years ago she started her business, which has slowly been growing.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her bookstore.  She hopes that with your support she can keep fighting to succeed in her business and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for a bookstore.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene 51 años de edad. Comenzó hace más de 10 años vendiendo caramelos, en el centro de la ciudad, y en los buses, después por su discapacidad visual tiene que cambiar la línea de productos ahora vende: papas, chifles, maduros, y le gusta mucho lo que hace con eso se puede mantener.

El trabaja solo en su local, desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 17:00 de la tarde,  vendiendo chifles, papas, rufles, etc. El tiene dos dificultades en su trabajo, primero su discapacidad visual el cual no le permite desenvolverse con normalidad en su negocio. La otra es las personas de mal corazón que le compran con monedas falsas, billetes falsos.

El no tiene  esposa. Y tampoco tiene hijos. Con el préstamo el va a comprar productos para su venta de su trabajo como papas, chifles, maduros. Sus sueños para un futuro es tener un local en el cual trabajar y que no  discriminen  a las personas con discapacidad, y poder dar empleo y así tener las mismas oportunidades que tienen todas las personas.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil. He is 51 years old and began selling candy more than 10 years ago in the central part of the city and on the buses. After he became visually disabled, he switched over to different products and now sells potatoes, banana chips, and fried plantains. He enjoys what he does, so he is able to support himself.

The borrower works alone in his shop from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. He sells banana chips, potatoes, potato chips, and other items. He experiences two difficulties with his work. First of all, his visual disability does not allow him to engage in his business in a normal manner. The other difficulty is that cruel-hearted people have purchased merchandise with counterfeit money.

The borrower is not married nor does he have any children. With this loan, he will buy products to sell in his shop such as potatoes, banana chips, and fried plantains. His dreams for the future include having a place where he can work and others do not discriminate against people with disabilities by providing them with jobs. He would also like to have the same opportunities that are offered to everyone else.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, banana chips, and fried plantains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified coffee plants and seeds

loans.name: Nork's Group

texts.en:
Nork is 33 years old and married with two children, all of whom are still in school. She and her family live in a village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on three hectare of farmland for almost 10 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day.

Nork is the second cycled client while her group member is the fourth cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully used past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Noris

texts.es: Noris de 51 años de edad vive en el suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus hijos en las edades de 17 a 15 años. Allí se dedica a la venta al detalle de ranchos, víveres, refrescos, cárnicos y artículos de la canasta familiar que compran las familias vecinas diariamente para elaborar los alimentos. Dese hace 20 años dio inició a su negocio teniendo en cuenta que en el sector no existía una tienda con estas características, poco a poco fue construyendo sus  propia clientela y hoy la identifican varios de los sectores aledaños. En la actualidad ha recibido 4 financiamientos de  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado mantener inventarios y vender de todo un poco de lo que su clientela solicita. Su sueño es ampliar la estructura de su negocio y tener un crecimiento sostenido, para apoyar aun más el bienestar de su familia. Esta es justamente la razón por a cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ranchos, víveres, embutidos, enlatados etc, pues necesita tener muchos de estos productos en esta época, en la cual la semana santa aumenta su consumo, por la especialidad de las comidas que comparten las familias en esta temporada. Y esto es justamente la razón de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Noris is 51 years old and lives in the southwestern part of the city with her husband and her two children, who are 15 and 17 years of age. She has a grocery store where she sells meats, canned goods and other food and household items. The neighboring families visit her store daily to get ingredients for their meals. She started her business 20 years ago, taking into account that there was not a store in her area to meet these needs. Little by little she built her own customer base, and today she is also known in some nearby districts. To date she has received four loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With these funds she has been able to maintain her inventory and to provide what her customers ask for. Her dream is to expand her business and have sustained growth, so that she can do an even better job of supporting the well-being of her family. This is just the reason she is seeking a loan through Kiva. She will use the loan to buy meats, canned goods and other food items. It is necessary to have a lot of these products at this time, since people consume more during Semana Santa (Holy Week) when they share meals with their families. And this is exactly the reason this will be a successful loan.

loans.use: to buy meats, canned goods and other food items.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha is 32 years old and a married mother with four children; all are in school. To support the family and also the children's education fees, Pha sells vegetables and her husband does rice farming. In addition, they raise piglets for sale. 

Pha and her other group member are on their fourth loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Each of them asked for KHR 1,400,000. 

Pha, as the head of the group, will use her loan portion to buy more piglets and more vegetables for further sale. Through this loan, Pha dreams to expand her piglets business in order to make more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, a married mother of three kids, is a local farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She makes a living through rice cultivation and pineapple growing, from which she is able to earn up to 22,500 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the second loan for Chan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  The past loan, which she has repaid, has successfully supported her life as well as her business at a good pace. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her farmland. Therefore, she applied for a new loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in order to buy potash, and to pay other necessary fees, including the plowing fee and labor fee. She hopes that she can gain a high yield from her crops so that she can sustain her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy potash, and to pay necessary fees, including the plowing fee and labor fee.

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en:
Da, 38, is a married mother of three children in school. She is a local farmer who grows rice and cassava as the primary source of income and supplements the family’s income via working for others for a fee. For 13 years, she has been engaged in the current business and she is able to earn up to 27,800 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Da with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is a leader in the group consisting of four female members. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay a potash purchasing fee, and to lease additional farmland for growing more cassava. She highly hopes that she can gain more yield from her crops and sell with high income so she can build a big house for her kids.

loans.use: to pay a potash purchasing fee, and to lease additional farmland for growing more cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Yok's Group

texts.en:
Age 41 and the mother of three (two who attend school), Yok is a local citizen from the Battambang province. She overcomes the family's financial burden by providing decent food through three hectares of rice farming; her husband works for others for a fee at a construction site. She has been in this business for ten years. 

Yok has never been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, prior to this loan.  Her group consisting of three female members; they are first time borrowers seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As the group leader, Yok will use her portion to buy six sacks of fertilizer and rice seed. She hopes to grow her rice seasonably and received a good yield to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of fertilizer and rice seed for her farming venture.

loans.name: Atymas

texts.en: Originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Atymas is married and blessed with five children who are students in the local state school. To tackle a huge expense in the family such as daily decent food, as well as the children’s education, she has managed various businesses including cashew nut trading, bread selling, and rubber tree growing. She has been involved in the business for five years and is able to earn up to 127,200 KHR per day. Atymas is the new client to VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use her loan portion to buy cashew nuts from others’ plantations for resale. She hopes this purchase will help her to collect cashew nuts on time and sell with high prices so she can uplift her living to a good status.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts from others’ plantations for resale.

loans.name: Jheny Felicita

texts.es:
Jheny es una mujer de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jheny no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Turismo y Hotelería, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jheny trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 11 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Jheny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que una de las habitaciones de su hogar está deteriorada y desea tarrajearla y ponerle piso, así pues Jheny seguía trabajando y esforzándose para brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Jheny is 45 years old.  She lives in the city of Ica, Peru, with her two children, whom she loves and who are her main impetus in her life.  She is very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic.  She devotes all her efforts to raising her family, as she is both father and mother to her children.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and out of necessity Jheny had to work from a very young age and was not able to pursue studies toward a career in the tourism and hospitality industry.  In her spare time she likes to distract herself by watching TV and sometimes by cooking a delicious chicken dish to share with her family.

Through her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Jheny works in her small business selling groceries and beverages.  She works every day for approximately 11 hours and believes that she is doing well by virtue of the good prices and the kind treatment she offers her customers.

Jheny is grateful to Kiva lenders and will be able to make improvements to her home with the financial assistance.  One of the rooms in her home is damaged and needs a new floor.  Jheny will continue working and striving for greater security and prosperity for her family.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Sokhev's Group

texts.en:
Sokhev, 27, is married and has three children. Her entire family resides in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. For her family, two hectares of rice farming are the primary source of income; her husband’s job as a construction worker is supplemental income. 

She is in the fifth cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  She has succeeded in repaying her previous loans, and has improved her standard of living progressively. 

Now, she leads a group consisting of two females. She and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee. 

She hopes to grow a healthy crop and triple her yield so that she can maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
A married woman from Battambang province, Khorn is a peasant in the local area who grows rice and pineapple to earn a living. The 10-year engagement in the current business returns her about 15,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. Khorn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three loan cycles. After the successful past loans, she feels confident that she can improve her livelihood greater than before. 

Now, she forms a group of other three females to apply for a new loan. She and another two joint members are each seeking 1,400,000 KHR, while the remaining co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay the water-pumping fee for her pineapple plantation. She does believe that she can gain double yield from her crops; thereby, she can make more income to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the water-pumping fee.

loans.name: Annali Zileri

texts.es:
Annali es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Annali se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Alimentos, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Picante de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Annali trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Annali se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción de un cuarto en su vivienda, ya que desea poder tarrajear y pintar dicha habitación, de esta manera ella desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues Annali seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar su carrera y convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Annali is a 20 year old woman who is single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings.  She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get ahead.  Thanks to her efforts and the support of her parents, Annali is currently studying for a professional career in Food Engineering.  In her free time she likes to read and occasionally she makes a delicious Picante de Res dish (Spicy Beef) to share with her family.  

By her own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Annali works as a field hand in an agricultural cooperative in her city.  She works every day for approximately 8 hours and she believes that things are going well because of her dedication and for the kind way she treats others.  Annali is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support she will be able to improve a room in her home.  She wants to plaster and paint that room, and in that way she hopes to bring better security and well-being to her family.  For this reason Annali continues working and making an effort to achieve her great dream of finishing her studies and becoming a great professional.

loans.use: To make improvements to a room in her home.

loans.name: Raul Martin

texts.es:
Raúl es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial  con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para poyar a sus padres, Raúl no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, desde hace un año Raúl trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Raúl se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder refaccionar el techado de su vivienda, ya que actualmente este es de cañas y plásticos, y al acercarse la época de invierno necesita mejorarlo para brindar  mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de de convertirse en un buen profesional y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 23 year-old man who is single and lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial.  He lives with his parents and siblings, and is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead.  Sadly, because of a lack of economic resources and due to the need to work in order to support his parents, Raúl has not been able to pursue a professional career as an automobile mechanic, but her would very much like to do so.  In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and on occasion cook a delicious Ají de Gallina, or garlic chicken, which he shares with his family.  

With much hard work and dedication, and thanks to the support of his mother, for the past year Raúl has worked as a field hand in an agricultural cooperative in his city.  He works everyday for approximately 10 hours.  He feels happy in this work and believes that things are going well because of his responsibility and because of the kind way in which he treats others.  

Raúl is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered he will be able to purchase construction materials, which will help him to rebuild the roof of his house.  Currently the roof is made of cane and plastic, and as the winter approaches he needs to improve it in order to offer better security and well-being for his family.  In this way he will continue working and pushing himself in order to achieve his great dream of becoming a professional and little by little to get ahead.

loans.use: To make improvements on the roof of his home.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio, tiene 28 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio del Negrito Yoro.  Hace 6 años que Sergio estableció su propio negocio para vender repuestos de motocicletas y reparación de las mismas. Anteriormente apoyaba a su padre en actividades agrícolas y estudiaba, ahora se dedica a su propio taller. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 26,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar repuestos para la venta y reparación de las motocicletas. La inversión le va ayudar a mejorar la atención al cliente. Sus planes son obtener ganancias para mejorar su casa y ahorrar para que sus hijos estudien y lograr estabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sergio is 28 years old and married with three children. He lives in the town of Negrito Yoro. Six years ago he opened his own business repairing motorcycles and selling spare parts. Formerly he used to help his father in farming activities while he was studying. Now he makes a living running his own garage.

Sergio has requested a loan of 26,000 HNL, which he will use to purchase spare parts to sell and to use in repairing motorcycles. The investment will help him to improve his service to customers. His plans are to earn a profit and use it to fix up his house, save for his childrens’ education and stabilize his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair motorcycles, as well as to re-sell.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 47 years old and married. She is blessed with six children, three of whom currently are still in school.

To cover the daily cost of living, she grows rice, pineapple and chili as the main source of income. She has been involved in the current business for 18 years. Sok, the third-time borrower, formed a group of three to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She, after the past loan which she has completely repaid, feels empowered that she can better support her living in a gradual manner.

As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and potash for her pineapple. She highly hopes that she can boost her pineapple yield better than before and sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potash for her pineapple

loans.name: Juan Milton

texts.es: Milton  es  un joven originario de la ciudad de Somotillo, casado, trabajador, honesto, responsable  en su trabajo y su  hogar, se ha presentado a las oficinas de Ceprodel solicitando un préstamo, para construcción de vivienda, donde necesita comprar materiales, Bloque, Hierro, Cemento, Zinc, para tener un techo digno.
texts.en:
Milton is a young man originally from the city of Somotillo. He is married, hardworking, honest, and trustworthy at work and home. 

He has visited the Ceprodel offices requesting a loan for housing construction. He needs to buy supplies such as blocks, iron, cement, and zinc in order to have a decent roof.

loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, and zinc.

loans.name: Sophun

texts.en:
Age 28 and a mother of two kids who are still in school, Sophun is a cassava grower on 4 hectares of farmland and a citizen from Kampong Cham province. To better feed the family, her husband also works for others for a fee after helping her on the farmland. Engaging in the current business for 10 years, she is able to earn up to 30,500 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Sophun is new to VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is seeking this first microloan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in order to pay for labor costs, plowing fees, and to buy potash as well as pesticide. Moreover, she will use a portion of her loan to lease an additional plot of farmland. She hopes that she can make more income for her family so that she can build a new house fo her kids and buy a mini tractor to support her business.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs, plowing fees, and to buy potash as well as pesticide.

loans.name: Hacheut

texts.en:
Hacheut is a farmer from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is 42 years old and has three children. To tackle the family’s financial issues, she is a cassava grower and her husband is a wooden house builder. For six years of engagement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 27,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Including this loan cycle, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She, after the successful loan which she has fully repaid, feels so confident that she can relieve her family’s burden and improve its livelihood better than before. Now, she applies for a new loan with VisionFund in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in order to pay plowing fees and labor costs. In addition, she will use it to buy two cows for raising. She hopes that she can sustain her living in a gradual manner.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and labor costs.

loans.name: Carlos Paul

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 24 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial  con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Carlos no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer manufacturas y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace un año Carlos trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrán realizar la construcción de la parte trasera de su vivienda, ya que actualmente está cercado de madera y cañas, las cuales no brindan seguridad, así pues Carlos seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio de pastelería y así poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 24 year-old man who is single and lives in the city of Cañete in the District of Imperial.  He lives with his parents and siblings and is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get ahead.  Sadly due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Carlos has not be able to pursue a professional career, but he would very much like to do that.  In his free time he likes to do metal work, and on occasion he makes a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (traditional Peruvian pork and pasta dish) to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with much hard work and dedication, for the past year Carlos has worked as a field hand in an agricultural cooperative in his town.  He works every day for approximately 10 hours and he believes that things are going well because he is responsible and he treats others well.  Carlos is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to build the back section of his house.  Currently it is made with wood and cane, which does not offer much security.  Carlos will continue working and pushing himself in order to achieve his dream of having his own pastry business and thus to be able to get ahead.

loans.use: To build that rear section of his home.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María trabaja como ayudante de cocina, su nivel de educación es secundaria, vive en casa familiar ocupando 3  habitaciones en un acabado fino  y piso de cemento. Ella también vende cerveza los fines de semana.
María trabaja 8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación de su hija.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de otra habitación de su vivienda y así mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su hija.

El sueño de María es que su hija termine sus estudios y salga profesional.

Es la quinta vez con IMPRO y la tercera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. María works as a kitchen helper. She has a secondary education and lives in the family home, occupying three rooms with finished walls and a cement floor. She also sells beer on the weekends.

María works eight hours a day in order to cover the food, light, water and education expenses for her daughter. She needs the loan to repair another room in her house and to improve her and her daughter’s quality of life.

Maria’s dream is that her daughter finish her studies and becomes a professional. This is her fifth time with IMPRO and her third time with Kiva.

loans.use: to repair one of the rooms in the house where she lives.

loans.name: Bertalina

texts.es: Bertalina, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Puerto Cortes. Hace 9 años que inicio su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, abarrotería, achinería, y otros productos como lasos, productos plásticos etc. Ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de varios préstamos.  Actualmente solicita el sexto préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de productos como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, productos plásticos, achinería y otros para mantener surtido el negocio. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Bertalina is 57 years old. She is a single mother with three children. She lives in a village in the town of Puerto Cortes. Nine years ago she started her own business selling food products, such as basic grains, groceries, low cost consumer goods and other products such as ropes, plastic items, etc. She has been able to sustain her business with the help of several loans.

Currently, Bertalina is requesting her sixth loan for 20,000 LNP, which she will invest in purchasing products such as basic grains, sugar, butter soft drinks, plastic items and other low cost consumer goods, so that she can keep her business well-stocked. Her goal is to expand her business in order to increase her sales and income.

loans.use:
.
to purchase food products for her store as well as plastic items and other low cost consumer goods.

loans.name: Vun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Von is married and has five children. To strive for a living, she works for others for a fee, wrapping sandwiches and rolled hashed meat, while her husband mainly focuses on the rice farm, corn field and cow-raising.

Von has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages and is in her eighth loan cycle. The subsequent loans have improved her business steadily and returned her a decent income to upgrade her living status at a good pace. For the upcoming replanting season, she is in need of working capital to support her business, so she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan.

She and her other two fellow group members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy pesticide and rice seed. She hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully and gain more profit.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and rice seed

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea, 49, is a rural villager from the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has six children, some of whom are students and some are working for others for a fee.

She deals with her family’s hardship via one hectare of rice growing and pig-raising. Her husband also helps in making more income through working at the fishing community in the area. It is the business that she has been with for 15 years and is able to earn up to 41,700 KHR per day. Including this loan cycle, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has stabilized her business to be in a good shape.

Now she joins a group composed of two female members. The total amount of their entire requested loan is 2,400,000 KHR. For Kea as a group leader, and whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, she will use it to buy four pigs, pig feed and to fix a pigpen. She hopes to fatten her pigs to a healthy condition so she can sell them for a high price and gain more income so she can buy an additional plot of farmland for expanding her rice cropping business.

loans.use: to buy four pigs, pig feed and to fix pigpen

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
A married man from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Sok is a local farmer and 59 years old. He manages a rice farm and watermelon field as the main source of income and catches fish during his spare time to better feed his family.  He has been involved in the current business for ages and its returns him about 24,000 KHR per day.

As a four loan cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), he feels confident that he can improve his living gradually and use his loan wisely in supporting his business. Now he joins with a female borrower who has never been with VisionFund before. As a group leader, he will use his loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed and to pay for plowing fees. He hopes to receive more yield and better his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla is a young mother blessed with two little kids, a boy and a girl. She is 28 years old and a local resident of Battambang province. She struggles with making a living through a rice cultivation business with the support from her husband. During the spare time from this agricultural activity, she is also a fish vendor, buying and reselling, whereas her husband works for others for a fee to supplement the family’s income. She has just been engaged in her current business for 5 years.

This is the second microloan for Phalla’s group consisting of two female members. She is very pleased indeed with her past loan as her living status is getting better gradually.

For this loan cycle, she wants to expand the scale of her fish trading. Therefore, she will use her loan portion to buy more fish for resale. She highly hopes that she can earn more income and build a new big house for her kids and others.

loans.use: to buy more fishes for resale

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in leather handbags. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of leather for production.

Arturo has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I have specialized in tooled leather since 1995. My parents are in the clothing industry where I learned many of the techniques I apply to leather. I am the father of two children, and I get many design ideas from my wife, Veronica. I prefer creating desk accessories, handbags, briefcases, and luggage. We use hand tools, and I've formed a community of artisans who collaborate with me. Our designs are lovingly crafted by hand, and we feel a personal attachment to what we do.

Thank you in advance for your significant support with this microcredit. It will allow me to acquire a good stock of raw materials at a good price so that I may increase my stock of finished products and not lose sales."

Use the link below to view Arturo's leather bags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3957

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of leather for production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio, originally from El Salvador, founded Sergio’s Concrete Inc. (SCI) in early 2012. Previously, Sergio had worked in the concrete industry for 14 years, performing as a project estimator and foreman for well-known local companies. During the first months of his own business operation, Sergio kept his full-time job. Now he is exclusively focused on developing SCI.

SCI provides concrete construction including foundations, slabs, floors, sidewalks, curbs, equipment pads, patios, retaining walls and others. SCI business has been more focused on residential projects, but now Sergio is looking to move his business to the next level and started bidding on commercial contracts.

SCI is requesting $10,000 to increase its working capital. It is a common practice in the commercial construction industry that subcontractors get paid in 30-45 days after completing the job, with no cash advances provided, but Sergio has weekly payroll.

loans.use: to finance account receivables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en: A 54-year-old mother of seven kids, Thon is also a local villager inhabiting the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is married and currently three of her children are in school in the local area. On one hectare each, she grows rice and plants cassava as their primary source of income. She is able to earn up to 18,800 KHR. She has been farming for 20 years. This is the third loan for Thon with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loans, which she has repaid, have provided her a decent income. Now, as a group of two, is applying for a new loan. She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR while her joint member is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. Thon, as a group leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, potash, and rice seed. She does believe that this purchase will help her to grow her cash-crop fruitfully and increase her income to support her living and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, potash, and rice seed.

loans.name: Everlides

texts.es: Everlides  invirtió su anterior credikiva en una moto y materias primas e insumos con los que fabricó calzado. Desde que recibió su crédito ha mejorado su calidad de vida, porque sus ventas se han incrementado. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores: “Les agradezco el apoyo que me han dado, espero seguir contando con él. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará capelladas taches , pegantes pues necesita cubrir un pedido grande Y NO CUENTA con capital  de trabajo suficiente para responder de manera oportuna, con ello sus ventas s e incrementarán y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Everlides invested her last Kiva loan in a vehicle and raw materials and supplies with which she made footwear. Since she received her loan her quality of life has improved because her sales have increased. She sends the following message to her donors: "I appreciate the support you have given me, and I hope I can continue to count on it." She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan which she will use to purchase straps, toecaps, and glue as she needs to fill a large order and she doesn't currently have the necessary working capital to complete the order in a timely manner. The order will increase her sales, and this is precisely the goal of your investment.

loans.use: to purchase straps, toecaps, and glue for shoes.

loans.name: Cecilia Geraldine

texts.es:
Cecilia es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo Cecilia se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Laborista Química, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cecilia trabaja como auxiliar en el área de laboratorio de una clínica de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Cecilia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de materiales de laboratorio para toma de muestras, de esta manera ella podrá realizar mejor sus labores, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio laboratorio médico.
texts.en:
Cecilia is an 21 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who really wants to get ahead. Thanks to her hard work, Cecilia is studying the technical major of Chemical Lab Technician. In her free time, she likes to listen to music and sometimes cook a delicious Frejoles con Seco to share with her family.

On her own initiative, with a lot of hard work and dedication, Cecilia works as an assistant in the laboratory of a clinic in her town. she works every day for approximately 8 hours and she thinks it is going very well for her because of her hard work and the friendly way she treats other people.  

Cecilia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered she can buy laboratory materials for taking samples. THis way, she can do her job better and keep working and striving to achieve her dream of having her own medical laboratory.

loans.use: to buy laboratory materials.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Yoeurn is a local farmer originally from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is 32 years old and a peasant who supports her living through cassava and rice growing. She has been farming for 12 years and is able to earn about USD 8 per day. Including this cycle, she is a third time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She feels empowered that she can improve her livelihood in time. Now she is seeking a new loan to buy potash and pesticide for her crops. Moreover, she is going to grow cashews for extra income. She hopes to grow her cash-crop fruitfully so she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy potash and pesticide for her crops.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Six females from Pursat province formed a group to ask for loans from VisionFund Cambodia, as they are in need of capital for their businesses. Yorn, who is the head of the group, plans to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her watermelon field, hoping it will produce more fruits and make more income. 

Yorn is widowed and has four children, two of whom work as paid workers. Yorn also does rice farming in addition to growing watermelon for sale to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her watermelon field.

loans.name: Soch's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia, Soch is a widowed mother who has eight children. To sustain a living, she grows cassava and rice. She is 59 years old and has 30 years of experience in the current business, which provides her a decent income of 13,900 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Soch has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for the past five loan cycles. She has succeeded in using the past loans to better support her business and uplift her lifestyle gradually; especially, she can afford the daily food consumption of her household, too. 

For this new cycle, she is a leader of a group consisting of three female members. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her farmland. She highly hopes that she can boost her crop husbandry in a big scale and better her income.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Kanoch

texts.en: Kanoch, 39 years old and married, is a local resident from Kampong Cham Province’s Dambae district. She has four children who are still living with her as three of them are still in school while a remaining one is helping with the family business. She and her husband do rice cropping and cassava planting. She has been farming for 20 years. Kanoch has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner for four cycles including this cycle. She has repaid back her past loans completely and it has helped her to provide daily, decent food for her children greater than she was able to before. Now she is seeking a new loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and to renovate her house. She hopes that she can gain more yield and earn a higher income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Phoeurk

texts.en: A 57-year-old father of nine children, Phoeurk is a citizen of the Ponhea Krek district in the Kampong Cham province. To provide for the daily food consumption of his family, he has managed various income generating activities including, sugar palm juice producing, rice cropping, rubber tree planting, and cassava cultivation. He has been involved in the current business for ages and is able to earn up to 40,000 KHR per day. This is the first micro loan for Phoeurk with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. He is going to use his loan to buy cassava seedlings, and to lease additional farmland. He hopes to receive double yield from his current various planting and make more income to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings, and to lease additional farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, de 30 años de edad, está casada con Segundo quien es médico y es el padre de sus hijos, con quienes habita una casa propia.La actividad que realiza Liz es la venta de fármacos y demás productos para la salud,razón por la cual cuenta con una botica la cual se encuentra en su propio hogar, ahorrándose más gastos de alquiler. Se inició en este negocio hace más de 05 años ya que vio la necesidad de los vecinos por contra con un establecimiento que le brinde lo necesario para sus dolencias.
Antes de tener su negocio, se encontraba en apuros económicos, ya que su familia crecía de manera acelerada con la llegada de sus trillizos por eso buscaron  alternativas de solución y decidieron colocar una botica, actualmente les va muy bien por eso tienen planes de continuar y hacer crecer su negocio con más mercadería  para así tener un stock disponible para la venta.Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva y esta muy contenta de saber que cuenta con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio , por eso se compromete a cumplir  con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 1200 soles para la  compra de medicamentos como pastillas, gasas , jarabes entre otros , buscando así precios más cómodos para sus compras en volumen y así brindar precios más bajos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Liz, age 30, is married to Segundo.  He is a doctor, and he is the father of her children.  They live in their own house.

Liz sells medicine and other health products.  That is why she has a drugstore in her own home.  That is saving her the expense of renting.  She started with this business over five years ago.  She did this because she saw the need that her neighbors had for an establishment that would provide what they needed for their ailments.

Before having this business she was having financial difficulties.  This was because her family grew rapidly with the arrival of her triplets.  Therefore, they looked for alternatives to solve the problem.  They decided to set up a drug store.  It is now going very well for them.  Therefore, they have plans to continue and to make her business grow with more merchandise.  They plan to have more stock available for sale.

This is her third loan with Kiva.  She is very happy to know that she has a loan in order to advance with her business.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will now request 1,200 soles to buy medicines like pills, gauze, and syrups, among others.  She is looking for the most affordable prices by purchasing in volume.  This way she will give her customers lower prices.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Seap's Group

texts.en:
Seap is 65 years old and married with two children. She lives in a rural village of the Sangke district, Battambang province. Catching fish has been her family’s main source of income for three years. She also sells fish in her village to earn additional income. Currently, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to feed her family’s needs.

Seap’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She has been a member of VisionFund for one loan cycle already and completely paid back the loan. The past loan helped her family with sufficient food and better support of the business. 

Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fishing materials for her fishing business, and will use a portion of it to spend on buying more fish to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to catch more fish and sell fish at a good price in the market.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Cham Province, Pheap is married and has two children. He strives for a living with his wife through cassava cropping on one hectare area and cashew growing on another four hectares of farmland. Having been farming for 10 years, he is able to earn up to 24,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Pheap with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner; it is his third loan. He has wisely used his past loans to better support his business and increase his income. Now, he is seeking 3,500,000 KHR in order to pay for weeding fees, plowing fees, and to buy pesticides. He hopes to gain more yield and make more profit for his family's sake.

loans.use: to pay for weeding fees, plowing fees, and to buy pesticide.

loans.name: Rose Sylvie

texts.fr: Rose Sylvie est une mère au foyer agée de 59 ans.après ses études,elle a ouvert un restaurant bar dans un quartier de la place,dans lequel,elle vend la viande de brousse,les boissons etc.....elle sollicite néamoins un credit qui va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock de marchandises(porc epic,gibier,pangolin...et boissons.les bénéfices générés seront réinvestis dans son activité et aussi le bien etre de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sylvie Rose is a 59-year-old housewife. Following her schooling, she opened a restaurant-bar in a local neighborhood where she sells bushmeat, drinks, etc...

She is however seeking a credit loan that will allow her to increase her stock of goods (porcupine, game, pangolin, and beverages).

Profits generated will be reinvested in the business and also be used to ensure the well being of her children.

loans.use: procure foodstuffs (porcupine, pangolin, monkeys, game) and also increase her stock of beverages.

loans.name: Jose Amado

texts.es:
El señor José Amado es originario del estado de Puebla, tiene ya mas de 20 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. 
Tiene mas de 15 años dedicándose a su negocio de reparación y venta de artículos y partes para carros, este pequeño negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para el y su esposa ya que todos sus hijos tiene su propia familia.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía, le están ofreciendo a muy buen precio y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad y tener mas inventario en su negocio, y mas ganancias.
texts.en: José Amado is originally from the state of Puebla but has been living in Nuevo Laredo for more than 20 years.  He has more than 15 years’ experience working repairing and selling items and spare parts for cars.  This small business is his source of income for him and his wife since all his children have their own families.  He’s requesting a loan to buy merchandise he’s being offered at a very good price and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity to have more inventory in his business and higher profits.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.pt:
Viúvo e pai de 10 filhos, 6 dos quais já maiores de idade e independentes, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem dos 4filhos ainda menores.
É militar do Ministério da Defesa Nacional e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos, rede, arame e outros) para construir uma capoeira e passar a criar frangos de corte. 
No futuro deseja crescer no negócio dele e adquirir mais experiencia, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir um mercado para o seu produto e desafiar a concorrência.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a widower and has 10 children, 6 of whom are already independent adults. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else other than his 4 underage children.
He's a serviceman for the National Ministry of Defense. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, wire mesh, etc.) in order to build a hutch and start raising broiler chickens.
In the future he wishes to expand his business and acquire more experience. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is getting an outlet for his product and presenting a challenge for the competition.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, wire mesh, etc.).

loans.name: Sreyvo

texts.en:
Sreyvo, a young 22-year-old mother of two, lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, where rice and cassava farming are a common way to earn a living. In business for four years, she earns about 18,500 KHR per day.

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sreyvo has borrowed and repaid three previous loans, all of which have improved her living standard. She is now seeking a new loan for 2,000,000 to help pay for fertilizer, insecticide, rice seed, and labor costs. She hopes to gain a greater yield to earn more profit.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, insecticide, rice seed, and labor costs.

loans.name: Walter Armando

texts.es:
Walter Armando habita en una de comarca de  Managua, su estado civil es casado, trabajador  de una institución del estado en Managua, donde se desempeña como higienista desde hace sietes años, tiene tres persona a su cargo, con dos menores en edad escolar, responsable luchador con aptitudes de superación para poder darle una vida mejor a su familia.

 El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar  materiales de construcción tales como bloque, cemento, hierro, para realizar un anexo de un cuarto ya que la familia va creciendo. 

Con este financiamiento lo va invertir en hacer su cuarto ya que sus padre lo apoya dándole donde vivir, porque su ingreso son muy bajo y no ha podido comprar su terreno por el momento, pero tiene fe con el apoyo de KIVA-CEPRODEL lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Walter Armando lives in one of the districts of Managua. He is married and works as state employee in Managua where he has been a hygienist for seven years. He has three people under his care. Two of them are school age children. He is a trustworthy go-getter with the capability to overcome in order to give his family a better life.

The loan that he is asking for from Ceprodel is to buy construction supplies such as blocks, cement, and iron to add a room since the family is growing.

He is going to invest this funding by adding a room as his father is giving him support where he lives because his income is very low and he has not been able to buy his land at the moment, but he has faith that with the help of Kiva and Ceprodel he is going to succeed.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: Joseph est un jeune camerounais de 28 ans. Père de 02 enfants dont le plus âgé a 02 ans et demi et le moins âgé 07 mois, il possède une boutique de vente de pièces détachées de motos. dynamique et ambitieux, joseph souhaite avec l'argent du crédit acheter les roues de motos, les chambres à air, les huiles moteurs et d'autres pièces de motos ceci dans l'optique d’agrandir son activé et par conséquent faire plus de bénéfices. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinjectés dans l'activité et permettront aussi à Joseph d'assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Joseph is a young 28-year-old Cameroonian. He is the father of two children, the eldest of whom is two-and-a-half years old and the youngest seven months.

He runs a shop selling spare parts for motorcycles. Dynamic and ambitious, Joseph wants to use the loan money to buy motorcycle wheels, inner tubes, engine lubricants and other motorcycle parts with the view of expanding his business and therefore make more profits.

The benefits gained will be reinvested in the business and will also allow Joseph to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus 3 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo desde muy joven de trabajar, William no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, William trabaja junto con su esposa en su pequeño negocio de venta de especerías y condimentos, adicionalmente tiene una mototaxi la cual alquila a otros choferes para que brinden servicios de transporte, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 11 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
William se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera podrá conseguir mayor cantidad de clientes y podrá atenderlos en un lugar adecuado.
texts.en:
William is a 32-year-old man who lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and three small children, whom he loves very much and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person.  He and his wife dedicate all of their efforts to providing a better life for their family.

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, he had to work from the time he was very young, so he was not able to pursue the degree in accounting that he had wished for. In his free time he likes to watch television, and sometimes he cooks the delicacy Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a dish made with chicken, pork and noodles) to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with much sacrifice and dedication, William works with his wife in a small business selling spices and condiments.  He also rents a motorcycle taxi to provide transportation services. He works every day for approximately 11 hours. He believes that things are going well thanks to his responsible work ethic and the friendly service that he provides to his customers.

William is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to purchase a small stand in the central market of his city. In this way he will be able to reach a larger number of customers and will be able to attend to them in a more suitable environment.

loans.use: to buy a stall for selling his goods.

loans.name: Din's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Din is a young 24-year-old mother blessed with two little kids. She feeds her family through growing cassava on a half-hectare area, while her husband works for others for a fee for extra income. 

She has been engaged in the current business for five years and is able to earn up to 13,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. She's in a group consisting of two females and is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed her crop husbandry wisely through her past loans to sustain her business; she has also fully repaid her past loans. 

With this new loan, she will pay plowing fees and purchase insecticide for her cash-crop. She hopes to minimize the loss due to pests and get back a high yield.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and to purchase insecticide.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 7 filhos, 5 dos quais já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante há muitos anos e é dona do negócio. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar panelas, potes e loiça plástica diversa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja investir ainda mais no seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir capital suficiente para ampliar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Deolinda is married and has 7 children, 5 of whom are already adults. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She has been a merchant for several years and owns her own business. With the current loan she intends to purchase pots, jars and miscellaneous plastic tableware in order to stock up with merchandise.
In the future she wishes to invest in her business even more. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is getting enough capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pots, jars and plastic tableware.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Encarnación se formó este grupo que se llama San Isidro, el que está ya en su quinto ciclo. Son 15 mujeres que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celia, quien esta en el nivel 3 de su encuesta de eliminación. Celia es comerciante, tiene una surtida despensa en su casa y comenta que con gran sacrificio esta hoy donde esta, ya que luchó mucho y se esforzó. Su meta es poder seguir con su trabajo y el día de mañana tener un negocio más grande y equipado.
Pide este crédito para la compra de verduras, enlatados, productos a granel y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y dando a su clientela todo lo que necesitan para poder seguir teniendo los ingresos que necesita.
texts.en:
The group San Isidro, already in its fifth cycle, was created in the city of Encarnación by 15 women who fight to get ahead and to give their families everything they couldn't have. Mrs. Celia is one of the group's members and is in level 3 of the elimination poll. Celia is a trader and has a stocked larder at home. She says that she has made many sacrifices to get where she's now and that she has fought and worked hard. Her goal is to keep her job and to have a bigger and better equipped business in the future. 

She's requesting this loan to buy vegetables, cans, products in bulk and other supplies to provide her clients with everything they look for and to continue having the income she needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, cans and products in bulk, among others.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz, de 54 años de edad, esta casada  con  Julián quien es empleado y  padre  de sus 2 hijos, juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa construida con material noble.La actividad que realiza Cruz es la producción y venta de golosinas, los cuales elabora en su hogar ,contando con ingredientes adecuados para su preparación las cuales vende al medio día en la puerta del colegio mas cercano a su hogar, logrando ganarse muchos  clientes por su buena atención y variedad de productos.
Dedicándose a dicha actividad hace más de 08 años, lo cual lo realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera ya que puede apoyar a su familia con los gastos  de su hogar, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene porque lo puede usar en otras actividades.Por otro lado comenta que la venta de golosinas, tiene bastante demanda ya que son productos de alto  consumo, por ese motivo tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio.
Este es el préstamo número 03 con Kiva, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito y así poder avanzar con su negocio, a su vez se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, para la compra de ingredientes que utilizara en la preparación de golosinas tales como azúcar , leche , entre otros , buscando así aumentar el stock de su mercadería disponible para la venta y así tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Cruz, 54, is married to Julián, who works and is the father of her two children.  They live together comfortably in their own house built of quality materials.

Cruz works making and selling candy, which she does in her home with sufficient ingredients.  She sells the candy at noon at the gate of the school closest to her house, and has acquired a lot of customers because of her good service and the variety of products.  She has worked in this business for more than eight years and does it with the help of her children.

What she likes about her job is the income it generates because she can support her family's household expenses.  She also likes her free time because she can spend it on other activities.  She says there's a lot of demand for selling candy because it's a high-consumption product.  This is why she plans to make her business grow.

This is her third loan with Kiva.  She feels happy and is grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit so she can make progress with her business.  She promises to make her payments punctually.

Currently she'll request 1500 soles [PEN] to buy sugar, milk, and other ingredients to make candy.  She's hoping to increase her stock of available merchandise to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Andre

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de1 filho, ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria feito de material local e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como segurança e tem um negócio próprio. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar loiça plástica diversa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja construir uma casa de alvenaria e prosseguir com os estudos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar o rendimento para conseguir realizar seus projectos.
texts.en:
Andre is married and has a son who's still underage. He lives in a house he owns which is made from local materials. He doesn't support anyone else.
He works as a security guard and owns his own business. With the current loan he intends to purchase miscellaneous plastic tableware in order to stock up with merchandise.
In the future he wishes to build a house made of masonry and move forward with his studies. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is increasing his income in order to accomplish his projects.

loans.use: to purchase miscellaneous plastic tableware in order to stock up with merchandise.

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en: Oeurn is 46 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is still in school and under her dependency. For her, rice cropping and cucumber planting are the primary source of income; she’s been engaged in this for ages and it gives her a decent income: about 19,000 KHR. The main challenges for her are the shortage of working capital to support her farmland and the low yield due to pests. To overcome these challenges, she has formed a group composed of three female members to apply for a new loan. She is a second-time borrower who has repaid her past loan already. The loan has supported her and her husband in a good manner. Moreover, she can afford to buy household items for her kids too including a TV, table, cabinet etc. Now, the total of her group loan is 2,400,000 KHR. For Oeurn, her loan portion will be used to purchase potash, rice seed, and pesticide. She hopes to increase her yield and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and pesticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en: Living in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sokna is married and has two children to care for. She makes a living through rice farming and growing cassava. To better the feed the family, she also works for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR from the current business that she has been with for 8 years. This is the fourth loan for Sokna with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans and feels confident that she can afford daily decent food for her kids. Now, in a group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to pay plowing fees and cassava reaping fees. She hopes to collect her yield on time and earn a good income to better her living.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and cassava reaping fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNIDOS PARA TRIUNFAR” Grupo conformado por 7 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas se encuentran pasando al ciclo 14. Carmen tiene 55 años es soltera con tres hijos mayores de edad. Carmen trabaja como ama de casa hace 35 años. El préstamo que se le hizo lo usara para la compra de materiales de construcción  de  su casa. Su mayor deseo es tener su casa más segura.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA  por el préstamo brindado.
texts.en: This is the “Unidos para Triunfar” (United for Success) group which is comprised of seven hardworking, enterprising women who are starting cycle 14.  Carmen, 55, is single with three adult children.  She has worked as a housewife for almost 35 years.  The loan she was granted will be used to buy building supplies for her house.  Her greatest wish is to have a safer house.  The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy housing construction materials

loans.name: Sokna's Group

texts.en: Sokna, 31, is a local villager from Kampong Cham province. She has two children to care for. To deal with daily food needs, she does rice cropping and cassava planting as her primary source of income with her husband as the helper. To better feed the family, this couple also works for others for a fee for extra income. She has been engaged in the current business for 12 years, and is able to earn about 22,000 KHR per day. Sokha has had six loans already with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in using the loans to make a better living than before. For this cycle, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. The entire loan is for 3,800,000 KHR. As group leader, Sokna will use her loan portion to pay plowing fees and cassava gathering fees. She highly hopes that she can double her income and upgrade her lifestyle so that it will be better than before.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and cassava gathering fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mereyra Nieves

texts.es:
Mereyra es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Mereyra no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mereyra trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas y refrescos, ella ocupa en pequeño espacio en su vivienda donde realiza sus ventas, Mereyra trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Mereyra se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de la fachada de su vivienda, adicionalmente también podrá comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas, como gaseosas, agua mineral y otros, de esta manera Mereyra podrá brindar un ambiente más adecuado y presentable para sus clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda, para poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Mereyra is 31 years old. She lives in the city of Ica with her husband and two young children who she loves and who are her reasons for living. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person. She and her husband put all their effort into providing for their family so they can get ahead. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and because she needed to start working at a very young age, Mereyra wasn't able go to school to become a professional. In her free time she likes to listen to music and on occasion, she makes a delicious chicken and rice dish to share with her family.

On her own initiative and through much hard work and dedication, Mereyra has a small business selling beverages and soft drinks. Her store is located in a small space in her home and Mereyra works every day for about 10 hours a day. She thinks things are going well because of her affordable prices and her friendly customer service.

Mereyra is very grateful for the micro loans from Kiva because they will help her make improvements to the front of her house to provide a more suitable and presentable atmosphere for her customers. She will also be able to buy larger quantities of beverages such as soft drinks, mineral water, etc. This will enable her to continue running her business and striving to achieve her dream of finishing her house construction for the security and well being of her family.

loans.use: make improvements to her house and purchase larger quantities of beverages.

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en: A local resident originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Dina is married and has two children who are still students in the local state school. She makes her living through her one hectare rice farm, raising pigs, and running a grocery store. It is the business that she has been with for 10 years. Dina is a second-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan which has helped support her business. For this cycle, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and her fellow group member are seeking for 2,500,000 KHR each.
