Yudith is 42 years old and has four children who are 14, 10, 9 and 6 years old.  They are all school age.  Yudith's business is making and selling handicrafts.  She hand crafts women's jewelry and has a sales location in Alto Olivo district.

This loan is Yudith's first with the institution.  She will use it to buy materials for making her handicrafts.  Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business.  Yudith will use the profits she makes to continue buying materials and thereby improve her income.  Her business goal is to have a large craft store so that she can provide a better service to her customers.  Yudith is a very hard-working person who feels happy for the opportunity which is being given both to herself and her fellow group members as, in some cases, they are supporting their families single handedly.

loans.use: to buy materials for making her handicrafts

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Santo Domingo, vive Martha, una mujer de 27 años, madre soltera de 3 pequeños que estudian en una escuela fiscal, su motivación de cada día es mantener y darles sus estudios para que un día se conviertan en profesionales y obtengan el título que ella nunca pudo tener debido a que los reducidos recursos económicos de sus  padres solo alcanzaron para que ella termine la primaria. 
Martha reside exactamente en la Parroquia de Río Verde un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. 
Aprovechando que Santo Domingo es el puerto que une a las Regiones Costa y Sierra del Ecuador, varias personas han establecido negocios de todo tipo para conseguir los ingresos que sirven mantener los gastos del hogar. Éste es el caso de Martha que en busca de cubrir las necesidades de su hogar decidió emprender con la venta ambulante de ropa casual desde hace 2 años, actividad que la aprendió en anteriores trabajos; invierte al menos 4 horas al día, pues también debe estar pendiente de alimentar y ayudar en las tareas a sus 3 hijos. Ella debe recorrer las largas calles de su ciudad tomando y entregando pedidos, cobrando y ofreciendo la ropa que mantiene en stock, es por esto que Martha ha decidido mejorar sus herramientas de trabajo comprando una moto lo cual hará con el primer crédito que obtenga de Fundación Alternativa. Con su moto Martha podrá trasladarse en menor tiempo hacia sus clientes y podrá atender mayor número de clientes, lo cual aumentará sus ingresos y así podrá atender las necesidades de sus hijos. Martha agradece a cada persona que en cualquier parte del mundo, a través de Kiva, decida apostar junto con ella por su crecimiento laboral.
texts.en:
Martha, 27, lives in the municipality of Santo Domingo. She is a single mother of three children that go to a state-run school. Her main motivation is to give them a good education so that they can become professionals and receive a degree, something she could not do herself because her parents lacked the resources to support her studies after primary school.

Martha lives in Parroquia de Río Verde, a historical site in Santo Domingo, which is the capital city of the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, in Ecuador. This province has grown steadily during the last few years. Its capital city is well-known for its fruits and cuisine. It also has important commercial activities and has become an important hub for commercial exchange between the mountain and coastal areas of the country. It also has numerous touristic sites that together with its warm climate attract local and foreign tourists.

Taking advantage of Santo Domingo’s location between the mountains and the coast, people has started all kinds of businesses in order to make a living and support their families. This is Martha’s case, who, with the intention to cover her home’s expenses, decided to start selling clothes as a street vendor two years ago. She learned this activity from her previous jobs and works at least four hours per day, since she also has to cook for her three children and help them with their homework.

Martha has to walk her city’s long streets, taking and delivering orders, collecting the money and offering the clothes she has in stock. This is why she decided to improve her working tools and buy a motorcycle with the first loan she receives from Fundación Alternativa. With a motorcycle, Martha will be able to shorten her travelling time and reach more customers. This will result in an increase in her income and a better support for her children. Martha wants to thank each and every person that, wherever in the world they might be, decided to join her through Kiva in this quest for growth.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to deliver her merchandise to her customers.

loans.name: Hovsep

texts.en:
Hovsep is a 29-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. He runs a shop where he sells clothing. Hovsep has been running this business for three years. Now he wants to add more inventory to his shop to increase sales. 

With the loan's help, Hovsep plans to purchase clothing for children. This is important for him to meet the demand of his clients and stay competitive in the market. Hovsep lives with his parents and his brother who is 16 years old. Development of the business will allow Hovsep to earn more income and provide more prosperous living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for clothing for children

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica al cuidado de su familia y elabora tamales, refrescos, entre otros antojitos para venderlos en su casa y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Los insumos para elaborar los antojitos los compra tres veces por semana en una tienda, ubicada en su comunidad.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más materia prima para prepara los antojitos y para construir una habitación a su casa. Con la inversión, dispondrá de mayor variedad de materia prima para elaborar diferentes platillos y Satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener un mejor ingreso; al mismo tiempo que estaría mejorando su vivienda para estar más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She takes care of her family and also makes tamales, soft drinks and other snacks which she sells from her home.  In this way, she helps her husband with their household expenses.  María buys the supplies she needs for making her snacks from a store in her community three times a week.

María is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo so that she can buy more supplies for preparing her snacks.  She will also build an extra room in her home.  As a result of this investment, she will have a larger range of raw materials available for making different dishes so that she can meet her customer demand and make better income.  She will also be able to improve her home so that her family can life in greater safety and comfort.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for preparing snacks, and to build an extra room in her home

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 33-year-old shopkeeper. He is married to Tabitha and they have two children. He has been running his retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES. 10,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan with KADET  LTD after repaying his previous loan successfully. 

Denis will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, tissue paper, sweets, green grams (lentils), etc., for his retail shop. He intends to plough back the income earned from his business and start investing for his children’s future. 


His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale shop and be able to provide his children with quality education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, tissue paper, sweets, green grams (lentils)
